searchTerms: the way of saint james - medieval europe's greatest pilgrimage
shortDescription: Santiago de Compostela, meaning "Saint James of the Field of Stars," has been one of the three most important Christian pilgrimage destinations since the medieval period, alongside Jerusalem and Rome.
name: Santiago de Compostela

primaryLocation.name: The Way of Saint James - Medieval Europe's Greatest Pilgrimage

longDescription: Santiago de Compostela, meaning "Saint James of the Field of Stars," has been one of the three most important Christian pilgrimage destinations since the medieval period, alongside Jerusalem and Rome. The city claims to hold the remains of Saint James the Greater, one of Jesus's twelve apostles and the first to be martyred. Saint James martyred in Jerusalem by Herod Agrippa
description:
Explore temples, mountains, groves, and holy sites that have served as gateways between the human and divine realms
                across cultures and millennia. From ancient stone circles to living pilgrimage destinations, discover the places
                where heaven touches earth.
significance: Santiago de Compostela, meaning "Saint James of the Field of Stars," has been one of the three most important Christian pilgrimage destinations since the medieval period, alongside Jerusalem and Rome.
